Package database

Class DBClients

java.lang.Object
database.DBClients
public abstract class DBClients extends Object
This abstract class is for manipulating the Client records in the database and not meant to be instantiated. The class contains methods to insert, update, delete and return all Client records as an ObservableList of Client objects.

    • insertClient

      public static int insertClient(String firstName, String lastName, String address, String zipCode, String phone, String email, int salespersonId, int stateId, int regionId) throws SQLException
      This method is used to insert a new Client record into the database.
      Parameters:
      firstName - first name as a string.
      lastName - last name as a string.
      address - address as a string.
      zipCode - postalCode as a string.
      phone - phone as a string.
      email - email as a string.
      salespersonId - salespersonId as an int.
      stateId - stateId as an int.
      regionId - regionId as an int.
      Returns:
      An int of the number of affected records
      Throws:
      SQLException - Throws a SQLException if the SQL commands do not execute properly.

    • updateClient

      public static int updateClient(int customerId, String updatedFirstName, String updatedLastName, String updatedAddress, String updatedZipCode, String updatedPhone, String updatedEmail, int salespersonId, int stateId, int regionId) throws SQLException
      This method is used to update a Client record in the database.
      Parameters:

      updatedFirstName - first name as a string.
      updatedLastName - last name as a string.
      updatedAddress - address as a string.

      updatedPhone - phone as a string.
      updatedEmail - email as a string.
      salespersonId - salespersonId as an int.
      stateId - stateId as an int.
      regionId - regionId as an int.
      Returns:
      An int of the number of affected records
      Throws:
      SQLException - Throws a SQLException if the SQL commands do not execute properly.
